meanings.definition: The process of oxidation caused by light.
meanings.sent1: Photooxidations can occur when certain chemicals are exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photooxidations to understand how light can change the properties of substances.
meanings.sent3: The photooxidations in the experiment made the solution turn a surprising shade of blue.
meanings.sent4: The photooxidations in the plant cells were like a dance of molecules under the sun's spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The photooxidations in the photochemical reaction were as bright as a burst of sunlight.

meanings.definition: The act of oxidizing through exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: Photooxidations can lead to the degradation of certain materials when left in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The photooxidations of the plastic bottle caused it to become brittle over time.
meanings.sent3: The photooxidations on the painting gave it a unique, sun-kissed appearance.
meanings.sent4: The photooxidations on the metal surface were like tiny sparks of rust forming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The photooxidations on the fabric were as gentle as a whisper of light fading its color.
